brief_summary.textblock:
To develop a clinical severity index that could prospectively identify sickle cell disease
      patients who were at high risk for a turbulent clinical course and a poor prognosis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Indices of Severity and Prognosis for Sickle Cell Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
DESIGN NARRATIVE:

      Using the database, univariate analysis showed that factors associated with the occurrence
      of cerebrovascular accident (51 patients) included hematocrit, rate of change of pocked red
      cell count, and polymer fraction at 40 percent oxygen saturation (PF40).  Only low
      hematocrit was predictive of death in the pediatric cohort.  There were 45 disease-related
      deaths.

reference.citation: Bray GL, Muenz L, Makris N, Lessin LS. Assessing clinical severity in children with sickle cell disease. Preliminary results from a cooperative study. Am J Pediatr Hematol Oncol. 1994 Feb;16(1):50-4.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
